image.altText: Peter Dutton election shadows

props.synopsis: A YouGov poll suggests Labor's momentum over the Coalition has firmed, with a two-party preferred vote approaching 53 per cent.

title.children: Dutton hints at Coalition campaign failure as polls show Albanese majority in sight

image.altText: green how to vote cards in the background with a text box that says enter your suburb

props.synopsis: The full set of major party players' how-to-vote guides for the House of Representatives reveals some surprising alliances.

title.children: The strange 'ballot-fellows' revealed on parties' how-to-vote cards

image.altText: Anthony Albanese NPC for Speers Column

props.synopsis: It's a sign that cost of living alone isn't enough for the Coalition at this point to convince undecided voters to boot out a first term government.

title.children: Surprise could lurk for Labor if enough voters vent anger over cost of living

image.altText: Scott Bessent and Yulia Svyrydenko sign papers at a desk in front of US and Ukrainian flags.

props.synopsis: The US and Ukraine sign an agreement to create a "reconstruction investment fund", two months after initial plans to sign a wartime deal were shelved when the countries' leaders spectacularly clashed in the Oval Office.

title.children: US, Ukraine sign resources deal two months after Oval Office clash

image.altText: A generic graphic image including a gold dollar sign and some websites.

props.synopsis: Cybercriminals have stolen and shared almost 100 staff logins for Australia's Big Four banks, putting those businesses at a higher risk of mass data theft and ransomware attacks, cyber security researchers say.

title.children: Hackers have 'compromised' almost 100 bank employees, experts say

image.altText: Simon Patterson walks through a sunlit carpark, dressed in a black suit and blue tie.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court trial of Victorian woman Erin Patterson, who is accused of using a poisoned meal to murder three relatives, continues. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Erin Patterson's estranged husband called to witness box in mushroom murder trial

image.altText: Young people in school uniforms sit in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has dropped his vow to change the national school curriculum, after comments earlier in the campaign that students should be able to think freely without being "indoctrinated" by educators.

title.children: Dutton drops vow to change school curriculum after 'indoctrination' claims

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: As voters head to the ballot box prepared to cast votes on the issue of housing affordability, new data shows national house prices trended higher in April, and are expected to keep rising as interest rates fall.

title.children: Property prices lift and growth in house values continues to outpace units

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling with several cameras behind him.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is campaigning in Perth and Peter Dutton is back in Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: 'I'm nervous': PM plays down election chances, despite polling boost for Labor

image.altText: Close up shot of arms holding a small child, whose bare leg and foot are visible.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple could face prosecution after they admitted to using a commercial surrogacy service to have a baby abroad, but experts say the laws need to change.

title.children: Couple who used overseas surrogate to have baby could face prosecution

image.altText: A graphic of parliament house surrounded by cards depicting different electorates

props.synopsis: A former journalist, a comedian and the man who used to be a Nationals pick — here are the candidates and seats that may land a surprise this Saturday.

title.children: The wildcard seats to keep an eye on this election

image.altText: A man in religious dress, with his hands pressed together in prayer.

props.synopsis: As dean of the College of Cardinals, this is supposed to be Giovanni Battista Re's moment. There's just one problem: the 91-year-old won't be in the Sistine Chapel when voting for a new pope begins next week.

title.children: This conclave, some of the most influential cardinals won't even be inside

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor will claim the Coalition's budget deficits would be at least $10 billion smaller than Labor's forecast $150 billion shortfalls over four years.

title.children: Coalition to release 'materially better, in double digits' budget costings

image.altText: Forklifts from HMAS Adelaide move pallets of humanitarian stores and disaster relief supplies on shore in Tonga

props.synopsis: Almost everyone has an opinion on Australia in the Pacific's capitals. Their leaders and civil society groups will watch its election result closely.

title.children: 'Dancing to their tune': What Australia's neighbours want after this election

image.altText: Donald Trump's face shown close up while he frowns and looks to his right

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has continued to spruik his government's economic record, hours after a government report showed the US economy had contracted for the first time in three years.

title.children: Trump signals 'tariff wall' for big pharma after US economy shrinks

image.altText: A black farmed mobile phone featuring a Meta logo in front of blurred social media platform logos

props.synopsis: Technology giants are on the rise in extended trade, following a volatile day on Wall Street as data revealed the US economy contracted. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Upbeat earnings from Meta and Microsoft boost market mood

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Reports Tesla is searching for Musk's successor
Australian share market slips in early trade

image.altText: An Indian border guard raises his hand in a gesture indicating stop to a car with two women in the back.

props.synopsis: Following a deadly militant attack, Pakistan and India have hit each other with a range of tough measures including cancelling visas, which has left families separated and wondering when they will be able to reunite.

title.children: 'We shouldn't have come': The families stranded at the Indian border

image.altText: A person posing for a selfie near the 40m cliff at The Gap on WA's south coast.

props.synopsis: Authorities say visitors are putting their lives in danger by going beyond the safety barriers to take photos at the Gap, a popular tourist site near Albany in WA.

title.children: Rescuers fed up with tourists risking lives for selfies at coastal cliff

image.altText: Silhouettes of two people walking down a dark street alongside emergency vehicles with blue siren lights illuminated

props.synopsis: The Spanish government has demanded energy companies provide data to explain "every millisecond" of a massive loss of power generation that disconnected the country's electricity.

title.children: Spain's cybersecurity investigator to quiz grid operator over blackouts

image.altText: katy perry

props.synopsis: Pop star Katy Perry says online criticism over her recent space trip has left her feeling "battered and bruised", but reassures fans she was "OK".

title.children: Katy Perry says Blue Origin backlash made her feel like a 'human piñata'

image.altText: Flooded street in outback town

props.synopsis: After an unprecedented disaster season in Queensland, climate action is not on the minds of many voters in some of the hardest-hit regions this federal election.

title.children: Climate action not swaying regional voters, despite year of disasters

image.altText: Monash independent candidate Deb Leonard.

props.synopsis: A Liberal stronghold is under pressure in Victoria as a veteran MP turns independent and a Climate 200-backed challenger looms with a well-resourced grassroots campaign.

title.children: Independent wave challenges 'rusted-on' status quo in Monash

image.altText: Composite images of three people - two women and a man - smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: After five weeks, and tens of thousands of contributions, the ABC's Your Say project has finished this election campaign where it began — with voters appealing for bolder ambition from their political leaders.

title.children: Days out from the federal election, this is what voters are telling Your Say

image.altText: A woman in a navy sweater sorts eggs

props.synopsis: Communities in the region surrounding Canberra are urging candidates not to forget their specific needs as the federal election approaches.

title.children: Minutes from Canberra, these towns still need more of the basics

image.altText: Two neighbouring homes, one with a sign for Kate Chaney the other for Tom White.

props.synopsis: Even in WA's most affluent electorate, cost-of-living pressures are weighing on voters' minds, as Curtin hopeful Tom White tries to win back the prized seat for the Liberals from teal independent Kate Chaney.

title.children: Climate concern shrinks in blue-ribbon Curtin, as Kate Chaney fights to survive

image.altText: Mark Carney grinning and raising the palms of both hands while standing in front of a blurred Canadian flag and wearing a suit

props.synopsis: The newly-elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit the White House within a week in the hope of securing a fresh trade deal, according to US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Canadian PM will visit White House to sign new trade deal, Trump says

image.altText: King Charles waving with a smile as he leaves a church service.

props.synopsis: It is the most candid the King has been about his health challenges since being diagnosed in February 2024.

title.children: King Charles opens up about 'frightening' and 'daunting' cancer experience

image.altText: Four Indigenous people, two wearing 'I love Naarm' t-shirts, pose in a city alley

props.synopsis: Two huge First Nations artist-led happenings are taking over the centre of Naarm/Melbourne this month, featuring Amos Roach, Kutcha Edwards, Miss Kaninna, Blackfire, Leonard Sumner and more.

title.children: 'Why not rip the door down?': International arts festival removing barriers

image.altText: A view of the Jerusalem skyline shrouded in smoke.

props.synopsis: Dry and windy conditions fanned the flames, forcing motorists on the main highway between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv to abandon their cars and run for their lives.

title.children: Israel calls for international help as wildfires erupt near Jerusalem

image.altText: Grey horse crosses the line at races

props.synopsis: A review of the Northern Territory racing industry is being undertaken by a consultancy firm that also represents Australia’s largest gambling company, sparking questions about its integrity.

title.children: Firm linked to major gambling company conducting NT government racing review

image.altText: Jannik Sinner holds the Australian Open trophy.

props.synopsis: Men's world number one Jannik Sinner admits he thought about walking away from tennis prior to accepting a three-month doping ban earlier this year.

title.children: Sinner considered quitting tennis during doping controversy

image.altText: A politician looking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: All venues to be built for the 2032 Brisbane Olympic and Paralympic Games, including the Victoria Park stadium, are set to be exempt from major planning rules — but some are questioning why safeguards are being removed.

title.children: Government to override 15 planning laws for 2032 Olympic venues

image.altText: A woman with a shovel

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says illegal gardeners are putting their health at risk by eating food grown on an unused plot of land in Brisbane's West End.

title.children: City's guerilla gardeners defy government health warnings
